delegate.translation[0].definitions[0].d: someone who has been elected or chosen to speak, vote, or take decisions for a group
delegate.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to give part of your power or work to someone in a lower position than you
delegate.translation[1].definitions[0].e: A good manager knows when to delegate.
It takes experience to judge correctly how much power should be delegated.
Minor tasks should be delegated to your assistant.
delegate.translation[1].definitions[1].d: to choose someone to do a particular job, or to be a representative of a group, organization etc
delegate.translation[1].definitions[1].e: I was delegated to find a suitable conference venue.
delegate.translation[2].definitions[0].d: someone who has been elected or chosen to speak, vote, or take decisions for a group
delegate.translation[2].definitions[0].e: Delegates to the union’s annual meeting are expected to endorse the plans.
delegate.translation[3].definitions[0].d: to give part of your power or work to someone else, usually someone in a lower position than you
delegate.translation[3].definitions[0].e: A good manager knows when to delegate.
Decision-making on a day-to-day basis will be delegated to team managers.
delegate.translation[3].definitions[1].d: to choose someone to do a particular job, or to be a representative of a group
delegate.translation[3].definitions[1].e: I’ve been delegated to organize the weekly meetings.
